intro: Cirrhopetalum bootanense, commonly known as the Bootan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, showy flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
